item.title: Albert Oehlen - Sexe, religion, politique | Max Hetzler & Gagosian
item.description: Albert Oehlen is a difficult artist to love, but an easy artist to admire. This is due to his tendency to treat his painting as an intellectual exercise within strict self-imposed boundaries, rather than a vehicle of sensual pleasure. This tendency is on show in a pair of identically- titled exhibitions in two of Parisâ€™ most prestigious private galleries: Max Hetzler and Gagosian. Each exhibition features works with a near-identical yellow hue: clearly another deliberately-imposed restriction from Oehlen.
